description: From Middle English ambitious, from Middle French ambitieus, from Latin ambitiosus, from ambitio; see ambition. Compare with French ambitieux.

adjectives.description: ambitious (comparative ambitiouser or more ambitious, superlative ambitiousest or most ambitious)

entries.meaning: (of a person or their character) Having or showing ambition; wanting a lot of power, honor, respect, superiority, or other distinction.
(followed by "of" or the infinitive) Very desirous
examples: Now he is joining a club ambitious to return to a model of dominating games and attacking opposition.

entries.meaning: Resulting from, characterized by, or indicating, ambition
examples: an ambitious attempt to take power
